title: [Large-scale] Customized Management Competency Enhancement Program for Adult Learners: Focused on Organizational Relationships, Civic Competencies, and Social Responsibility

context.prior_knowledge: Basic business theory and practical experience, foundational understanding of organizational collaboration processes and social responsibility, and elementary awareness of civic consciousness and community relationship improvement
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning with a focus on practical application through project collaboration. Includes case studies on improving corporate-community relations, with emphasis on civic engagement, rights protection, and SDG-linked analyses.

learning_goals: When formulating business strategies, learners utilize decision-making frameworks that reflect adult learnersâ€™ self-directedness and organizational civic consciousness, proposing stakeholder relationship adjustments and institutional improvements.

Through 15-minute microlearning modules on mobile devices, learners analyze global business cases considering economic, political, and cultural contexts, propose sustainable practices, and develop community collaboration plans.

Learners, working in teams of four, analyze real-world corporate case-based problems (e.g., interdepartmental collaboration delays) over three days, derive institutional improvement plans using SWOT analysis and the 5Whys technique, and achieve a score of 4 or higher (out of 5) in at least two of the four evaluation criteria (problem definition clarity, feasibility of solutions, team contribution, and consideration of social impact) during the final presentation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
